### Developing a Combined Metric: Annual Streamflow
```{r}

## metric is high stream flow
sager = read.table(here('data', 'sager.txt'), header = TRUE)
head(sager)


# add date
sager = sager %>% mutate(date = paste(day,month,year, sep="/"))
sager$date = as.Date(sager$date,"%d/%m/%Y")

# plot
sager_clean = sager %>% pivot_longer(cols=c("model","obs"), names_to="source",
                                  values_to="flow") # july-sept

## subsetting only annual summer streamflow: june - august
annual_summer_flow <- sager_clean %>% 
  group_by(year, month, source) %>% 
  filter(month %in% c(5:8)) %>% 
  summarize(flow = sum(flow))


## Plot of annual summer flow 
ggplot(annual_summer_flow, aes(year, flow, col = source, linetype = source)) +
  geom_line() +
  labs(x = 'Year', y = 'Annual Summer Streamflow') +
  scale_color_manual(values = c('blue', 'green4')) +
  theme_minimal()

```

```{r}
perf = compute_low_flowm(m=sager$model,o=sager$obs, month=sager$month, day=sager$day, year=sager$year, low_flow_months = c(6:8))

perf = as.data.frame((perf))
# remember you want error to be low but correlation to be high 
# so we need to transform in some way

# normalize by max error = if error is greater than this we don't care

# many ideas -  maybe 50% of mean daily summer observed low flow
tmp = sager %>% 
  subset(month %in% c(6:8)) 

errmax = mean(tmp$obs)*0.5

perf = perf %>% 
  mutate(annual_min_err_trans = max(0,(1-abs(annual_min_err/errmax) ))) ## annual min
      
# for monthly we can do a simpler thing to find maximum allowable errror   
tmp = sager %>% 
  subset(month %in% c(6:8)) %>%
  group_by(year, month) %>% 
  summarize(obs = sum(obs))

errmax = mean(tmp$obs)*0.5
 
perf = perf %>% 
  mutate(low_month_err_trans = max(0,(1-abs(low_month_err/errmax)))) ## low months

perf = perf %>% 
  mutate(combined = (annual_min_cor + annual_min_err_trans + low_month_err_trans + low_month_cor)/4)
perf

```
